The official Celery tutorials assume all configuration is available upon import, so this sample Flask server shows how to configure Celery in a factory pattern.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":307,"style":"color-rgb(36,41,46)"},{"offset":0,"length":307,"style":"fontsize-16"},{"offset":0,"length":307,"style":"fontfamily--apple-system, Flask app exposes an API that accepts a POST request to /task/ to start an task and return its ID. To check on the status of that task, issue a GET request to /task/<task_id>. The featured task is a dummy function that sleeps 5 seconds then returns a
